category: Hill Station / Tea Gardens / National Park gateway
timings: Tourist sites/open areas — Not documented (tea gardens/towns open daily; specific attractions may have hours).
entry_fee: Not documented (national parks / protected areas around Munnar may have fees — check specific park sites).
best_time: September to March — cooler weather, clear skies; monsoon (June–Aug) heavy rains.
nearest_railway: Aluva Railway Station — approx. 108 km (major railhead). (Bodinayakkanur in TN is closer but smallest).
nearest_bus: Munnar Bus Stand — within town (local/state buses).
nearest_airport: Cochin International Airport (Nedumbassery) — approx. 107–110 km
accessibility: Well-connected by road; steep winding highland roads; not all viewpoints wheelchair-friendly; moderate trekking possible.
guided_tours: Widely available (local guides, English/Malayalam commonly).
parking: Public/private parking available around town and viewpoints; charges vary — Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Hotels/resorts, restaurants, tea-tourism homestays, travel agents, shops.
special_notes: Famous for tea plantations, Eravikulam National Park (Neelakurinji blooms every 12 years), biodiversity and colonial-era bungalows. Kerala Tourism+1

timings: Houseboat cruises operate daily; beach/public areas open daily. Specific attractions have separate timings — Not documented.
entry_fee: Not documented (houseboat prices vary widely by operator and season).
best_time: November to February — pleasant weather, ideal for backwater cruises; monsoon heavy (June–Aug) — good for greenery but may disrupt boating.
nearest_railway: Alappuzha Railway Station — within city (~0–4 km).
nearest_bus: Alappuzha KSRTC / private bus stands — in town (walking distance).
nearest_airport: Cochin International Airport — approx. 78 km
accessibility: Roads good; many houseboats offer easy boarding but not wheelchair-accessible; mobility may be limited on boats.
guided_tours: Local houseboat operators provide guides/crew; many tours in English and regional languages.
parking: Parking available at jetties/boarding points; fees vary — Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Restaurants, seafood shacks, homestays, resorts, local markets, coir shops.
special_notes: Famous for traditional kettuvallam houseboats, annual Nehru Trophy Boat Race (seasonal), coir industry. Kerala Tourism+1

timings: Bird Sanctuary visiting hours are seasonal — Not documented on single official page; boat timings for wetland cruises vary.
entry_fee: Not documented (sanctuary entry/boat fees vary; check Kerala Tourism or local sanctuary office).
best_time: November to February — migratory birds arrive; best for birdwatching.
nearest_railway: Kottayam Railway Station — approx. 14 km (Kumarakom ~14 km from Kottayam).
nearest_bus: Kumarakom bus points and Kottayam bus stands — within short drive.
nearest_airport: Cochin International Airport — approx. 106 km
accessibility: Good road access; boardwalks and boat rides available — some areas not wheelchair-friendly.
guided_tours: Local birding guides and tour operators available (Malayalam/English).
parking: Limited parking at sanctuary/resort areas; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Bird-watching hides, resorts, houseboats, restaurants in Kumarakom/Kottayam.
special_notes: Important wintering ground for migratory birds; part of the Vembanad-Kumarakom ecosystem. Kerala Tourism+1

timings: Public beach — daily; lighthouse and some attractions may have specific hours — Not documented.
entry_fee: Not documented (public beach — free; specific facilities/activities have separate charges).
best_time: October to March — pleasant weather; June–Sept monsoon heavy.
nearest_railway: Thiruvananthapuram Central Railway Station — approx. 16 km
nearest_bus: Thiruvananthapuram central bus stands / Kovalam local buses — within short drive.
nearest_airport: Thiruvananthapuram International Airport — approx. 10–15 km
accessibility: Good roads from Trivandrum; beach access by short steps — some areas not wheelchair-friendly.
guided_tours: Widely available; Ayurveda centers provide treatments (language support common).
parking: Local parking available near beaches and resorts; charges vary — Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Resorts, Ayurvedic centres, restaurants, shops, water-sport operators.
official_website: Kerala Tourism Lighthouse Beach page (see below)
special_notes: Famous lighthouse beach, Ayurveda & wellness tourism; close to city but coastal charm. Wikipedia+1

category: Heritage / Colonial Fort area / Cultural zone
timings: Public area — daily; specific museums/attractions have distinct hours — Not documented.
entry_fee: Not documented (museums/monuments may charge small fees).
best_time: October to March — comfortable weather for heritage walks and festivals.
nearest_railway: Ernakulam Junction / Ernakulam Town — approx. 10–13 km (depending on approach)
nearest_bus: Ernakulam KSRTC / private stands in town; local ferries connect Fort Kochi.
nearest_airport: Cochin International Airport — approx. 36 km (varies by route).
metro_station: No metro in Fort Kochi itself (Ernakulam has metro stations inland; last-mile by road/ferry).
accessibility: Good road/ferry access from Kochi city; cobbled streets — partial wheelchair accessibility; some historic buildings have steps.
guided_tours: Many heritage walks, local guides (English/Malayalam) and cultural performances available.
parking: Limited within Fort Kochi; parking in Ernakulam and ferry/short drive into Fort Kochi — charges vary.
nearby_amenities: Cafés, art galleries, boutiques, restaurants, hotels, spice shops.
special_notes: Chinese fishing nets, St. Francis Church, Dutch Cemetery, colonial architecture; strong Indo-European cultural mix. Ernakulam District Website+1

timings: Park/sanctuary hours and Periyar boat timings vary — Periyar park often open 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM (check current site).
entry_fee: Park entry/boat fees vary by nationality and activity (Periyar lists Indian/foreign entry fees and camera fees).
best_time: September to March — cooler, safer for wildlife sightings and boat safaris.
nearest_railway: Kottayam Railway Station — approx. 101–114 km (nearest major railhead); some smaller stations closer in TN.
nearest_bus: Kumily / Thekkady bus points — within a few km (local/state buses).
nearest_airport: Madurai Airport (TN) — approx. 136–140 km (nearest domestic); Cochin Intl. further.
accessibility: Road access via winding plantation roads; boat rides on Periyar Lake; not all zones wheelchair-friendly.
guided_tours: Local guides and authorized safari guides available (languages: Malayalam, English).
parking: Parking available at reserve entry / Kumily — charges vary.
nearby_amenities: Spice plantations, homestays, hotels, souvenir shops, restaurants.
official_website: https://www.periyartigerreserve.org/ and Kerala Tourism Periyar pages
special_notes: Periyar is a major tiger reserve and biodiversity hotspot; boat safaris are the main attraction. Kerala Tourism+1

category: Archaeological site / Hill area / Trekking spot
timings: Visitor timings / trekking timings vary seasonally — Not documented centrally; local sites list timings for cave visits.
entry_fee: Not documented (small site entry fees possible; check local desk).
best_time: October to May — dry season, safer for trekking and access.
nearest_railway: Kozhikode (Calicut) Railway Station — approx. ~97–106 km (nearest major station)
nearest_bus: Sultan Bathery / Wayanad local bus stands — regionally connected.
nearest_airport: Calicut International Airport — approx. 100–106 km (Kannur also used)
accessibility: Requires uphill trek — moderate difficulty; not wheelchair-friendly.
guided_tours: Local guides available; archaeology interest groups often guide.
parking: Parking available at trailhead / site; fees Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Small eateries, shops, homestays in Wayanad towns.
special_notes: Prehistoric petroglyphs/rock carvings; high-altitude site and scenic viewpoints. Kerala Tourism+1

timings: Access checkpoints may close at dusk; specific visitor timings can apply — Not documented centrally (check local / Kerala Tourism pages).
entry_fee: Not documented (some parking/entry charges may be levied locally).
best_time: September to March — after monsoon falls are impressive but roads accessible; monsoon makes waterfalls fullest but access can be restricted.
nearest_railway: Chalakkudy Railway Station — approx. 30–35 km (Chalakkudy is nearest junction)
nearest_bus: Chalakudy / Athirappilly bus points — local buses available.
nearest_airport: Cochin International Airport — approx. 55–60 km
accessibility: Scenic but involves walking paths; variable accessibility — watch for slippery terrain.
guided_tours: Local guides and nature walks available.
parking: Parking at designated points; local charges may apply.
nearby_amenities: Small shops, tea stalls, local guides, guest houses in Chalakudy/Kothamangalam.
official_website: Kerala Tourism page for Athirappilly & Vazhachal
special_notes: Popular filming location for Malayalam/Tamil films; rich biodiversity in surrounding forests. Kerala Tourism+1

timings: Fort open generally during daytime — Not documented exact hours on single page.
entry_fee: Not documented (often free; some heritage sites may have nominal charges).
best_time: October to March — pleasant sea breeze and clear weather.
nearest_railway: Bekal Fort Railway Station / Kanhangad Railway Station — approx. ~13–16 km depending on station.
nearest_bus: Bekal bus stand — in town (~2 km to fort).
nearest_airport: Mangaluru International Airport — approx. 71–75 km; Kannur International ~101 km.
accessibility: Fort area approachable via coastal roads; steps/towers mean limited wheelchair access.
guided_tours: Local guides available; kasargod district tourism info desks.
parking: Parking near fort and surrounding park; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Resorts, eateries, beach promenades, local craft shops.
special_notes: One of the largest forts in Kerala; sea-facing observation towers; declared special tourism area in 1990s. Kerala Tourism+1

timings: Temple darshan timings vary and are seasonal (Mandala/Makaravilakku seasons are busiest); check official site for current timings and rules.
entry_fee: Not documented (darbhan/temple donations/puja charges vary).
best_time: Mandala season (Nov–Dec) and Makaravilakku (Jan) — peak pilgrimage times; otherwise open year-round for devotees following rituals.
nearest_railway: Chengannur / Thiruvalla — ~26–30 km (common railheads for pilgrimage).
nearest_bus: Pamba / Nilakkal / nearby KSRTC pilgrim bus points (seasonal special services).
nearest_airport: Cochin / Thiruvananthapuram depending on route; nearest practical larger airport varies (~140–200 km); Madurai used for some routes.
accessibility: Pilgrimage involves trekking on forest tracks (some devotees trek from Pamba); not wheelchair-friendly on the traditional paths.
guided_tours: Pilgrim groups and local services assist devotees; language: Malayalam, Tamil, English support in many arrangements.
parking: Large seasonal parking/transport hubs established during pilgrim season; charges and arrangements vary.
nearby_amenities: Pilgrim rest houses (Ayyappa Devaswom), eateries, medical camps during season.
special_notes: One of India’s most visited pilgrimage sites — strict dress and ritual codes apply for devotees; seasonal crowd management by authorities. Wikipedia+1

timings: Temple darshan timings and sevas vary — check Guruvayur Devaswom official site for puja schedules.
entry_fee: Not documented (general darshan often free; special sevas/rituals have fees).
best_time: Year-round — festival days (e.g., Guruvayur Ekadasi) attract large crowds.
nearest_railway: Guruvayur Railway Station — very near town / Thrissur major station ~26 km.
nearest_bus: Guruvayur bus stand — in town (walking distance).
nearest_airport: Cochin International Airport — approx. 80–90 km (or nearest major airport approx. 86 km per sources).
accessibility: Temple complex has steps and crowds; partial accessibility for differently-abled; check temple authorities.
guided_tours: Pilgrim assistance available; many local guides/temple officers provide help.
parking: Large parking in town for pilgrims; charges vary.
nearby_amenities: Prasad counters, lodging (annadanam), shops selling religious items, eateries.
special_notes: One of the most important Krishna shrines in South India; strong traditions and large-scale temple administration.

place_name: Silent Valley National Park, Palakkad (Kerala, INDIA)
timings: Park permits and trekking require prior permission; timings controlled by forest department — Not documented (special permit regimes).
entry_fee: Not documented (park permits required; follow forest department rules).
best_time: October to May — avoid southwest monsoon for trekking and access.
nearest_railway: Palakkad Junction (Olavakode) — approx. ~50–60 km (nearest major railhead)
nearest_bus: Mannarkkad / adjoining towns with bus services to park entry.
nearest_airport: Coimbatore / Calicut airports are the closest major airports (distances vary — Calicut often listed ~120 km).
accessibility: Remote, limited road access, sensitive ecology — not wheelchair-friendly; guided treks only with permits.
guided_tours: Only authorized/forest department-guided visits permitted in many zones.
parking: Limited at designated entry points; Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Basic amenities at nearest towns; limited facilities near park to protect ecology.
official_website: Palakkad district / Kerala forest department pages
special_notes: Pristine evergreen rainforest; high conservation value and endemic species; access tightly regulated to protect ecosystem. Wikipedia+1

timings: Thenmala ecotourism timings vary by activity — park hours often 09:00 AM to 04:00/08:00 PM depending on the program; check official TEPS pages.
entry_fee: Activity-specific (trekking, rope-bridge, boating) — Not documented as single figure; see TEPS for packages.
best_time: September to March — comfortable for trekking and outdoor programs.
nearest_railway: Thenmala Railway Station — short drive (on Kollam-Shenkottai line).
nearest_bus: Thenmala/Anchal local bus stops.
nearest_airport: Trivandrum International Airport — approx. ~70–80 km (nearest major)
accessibility: Well-maintained eco-trails; some activities have moderate physical requirements; partial wheelchair accessibility in lowland areas only.
guided_tours: TEPS operates guided eco-programmes, language support available.
parking: Parking available at visitor centers; charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Eco-resorts, snack stalls, restrooms, basic shops.
special_notes: India’s first planned eco-tourism destination with highlights like rope-bridge, trekking trails, and ecological interpretation programs. thenmalaecotourism.com+1

place_name: Cherai Beach, Vypin Island / Kochi (Kerala, INDIA)
timings: Public beach — daily; resorts and activity providers have their schedules — Not documented centrally.
entry_fee: Not documented (public beach — free; water sports/resort services at charge).
best_time: October to March — pleasant beach weather; monsoon season sees heavy rains.
nearest_railway: Aluva / Ernakulam South (~20–29 km, depending on approach).
nearest_bus: Local Vypin bus stops / Kochi central bus hubs.
nearest_airport: Cochin International Airport — approx. 22–27 km
metro_station: No metro in Cherai; nearest Kochi metro stations inland
accessibility: Short drive from Kochi; beach access involves sandy terrain; limited wheelchair access on sand.
guided_tours: Local tour operators and resorts offer activities and dolphin-spotting tours.
parking: Parking at nearby resorts and public lots — charges vary.
nearby_amenities: Resorts, cafes, restaurants, beachfront accommodations, local shops.
special_notes: Known for its long sandy stretch and view where backwaters meet sea; dolphin sightings reported. Kerala Tourism+1

category: Historic beach (Vasco da Gama landing) / Beach
timings: Public beach — daily; park/corniche open daytime.
entry_fee: Not documented (free public beach).
best_time: October to March — pleasant weather; avoid heavy monsoon.
nearest_railway: Koyilandy / Kozhikode Railway Station — approx. 10–20 km (Koyilandy closest ~10 km).
nearest_bus: Kozhikode main bus stand / local bus stops to Kappad.
nearest_airport: Calicut International Airport (Karipur) — approx. ~25–42 km depending on measurement.
accessibility: Road access good; beach access straightforward; sandy beaches — limited wheelchair access.
guided_tours: Local guides available for historical briefings.
parking: Public parking/corniche area — charges Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Park, restrooms, cafes, seating areas.
special_notes: Historic site of Vasco da Gama’s landing in 1498; Blue Flag beach status reported/maintained initiatives in area. Kerala Tourism+1

timings: Darshan timings listed (multiple windows morning/evening) — see Kerala Tourism / temple pages for detailed daily schedule.
entry_fee: General darshan free; special sevas/pujas paid (bookings via official portals) — check official sources.
best_time: Year-round; festival days attract large crowds (plan accordingly).
nearest_railway: Thiruvananthapuram Central Railway Station — approx. 0.6 km (walking distance ~8–10 min)
nearest_bus: Thiruvananthapuram central bus hubs (East Fort area adjacent).
nearest_airport: Thiruvananthapuram International Airport — approx. 4–6 km
accessibility: Temple area crowded with steps and large crowds; limited wheelchair access in some parts — check temple authorities for assistance.
guided_tours: Temple administration / pilgrim assistance available; guided explanation often provided by licensed guides.
parking: Public parking in city; near East Fort and commercial zones — charges vary.
nearby_amenities: Historic East Fort area markets, hotels, restaurants, museums.
official_website: Kerala Tourism temple page — https://keralatourism.travel/padmanabhaswamy-temple-trivandrum (and official temple portals)
special_notes: One of Kerala’s most famous temples; rich royal history and famous sanctum vaults (historical significance). Dress codes & temple customs apply strictly. Kerala Tourism+1

category: Backwater / Beach / Estuary (where river meets sea)
timings: Daytime visitors and boat cruises operate daily; specific facility hours Not documented.
entry_fee: Not documented (boat/cruise charges vary by operator).
best_time: October to March — pleasant estuary and beach conditions.
nearest_railway: Thiruvananthapuram Central Railway Station — approx. ~27–38 km (local landing points).
nearest_bus: Poovar local bus stops / Trivandrum bus stands.
nearest_airport: Thiruvananthapuram International Airport — approx. ~35–50 km depending route.
accessibility: Reachable by road/boat; last-mile may involve small boats depending on package — not universally wheelchair-friendly.
guided_tours: Boat cruises and resort packages offer guided tours; language support common.
parking: At nearby car parks/resorts — charges vary.
nearby_amenities: Resorts, backwater cruises, seafood restaurants, beach facilities.
official_website: Kerala Backwater / tourism pages (see Poovar guides)
wikipedia: Poovar has entries and tourism writeups (Tripadvisor/guide pages)
special_notes: Unique mix of backwater, golden beach, and estuary — scenic sunset cruises common. Kerala Back Water+1

category: Inland island group / Backwater canals / Village tourism
timings: Boat cruise / canal visits operate daily; specific timings Not documented.
entry_fee: Not documented (local boat/cruise charges).
best_time: October to March — calm backwaters and pleasant weather.
nearest_railway: Munroturuttu (Munroe Island) Railway Station — short distance; Kollam Junction ~25 km.
nearest_bus: Local Kollam bus hubs / Munroe Island access points.
nearest_airport: Thiruvananthapuram International Airport — approx. ~90–100 km (or Trivandrum used as nearest major).
accessibility: Access via road, rail and inland waterways; narrow canals require boat; limited accessibility for wheelchairs.
guided_tours: Local boat tours and village tours available; English/Malayalam language support common.
parking: Parking at mainland points before boat tours; fees Not documented.
nearby_amenities: Homestays, local eateries, village craft demonstrations (coir), basic shops.
special_notes: Known as “sinking island” problems and coir-making heritage; canal cruises show traditional livelihoods. Kerala Tourism+1

category: Dam / Garden / Amusement park / Family recreation
timings: Gardens/park typically open daytime; specific attraction hours (ropeway, amusement park) Not documented on a single source.
entry_fee: Park/amusement charges for specific rides — Not documented (varies per ride).
best_time: October to March — good for outdoor activities and gardens.
nearest_railway: Palakkad Junction — approx. 14–15 km
nearest_bus: Palakkad bus stands; local buses to Malampuzha.
nearest_airport: Coimbatore International Airport — approx. ~55 km
accessibility: Well-laid paths in garden areas; some attractions (ropeway, rock garden) have limited accessibility for wheelchairs.
guided_tours: Local guides/tour operators for Palakkad region.
parking: Ample parking near gardens; charges vary.
nearby_amenities: Restaurants, boating, Yakshi Garden, children’s play areas, hotels in Palakkad.
special_notes: Famous Yakshi statue and Japanese Garden; cable car and boating facilities popular with families. Wikipedia+1

place_name: Varkala (Papanasam Beach / Varkala Cliff), Thiruvananthapuram (Kerala, INDIA)
category: Beach / Cliff / Pilgrimage (Janardana Temple) / Ayurvedic centre
timings: Beach and cliff promenade open daily; temple timings follow religious schedules — Not documented in single dataset.
entry_fee: Not documented (public beach free; some paid wellness services).
best_time: October to March — pleasant seaside weather; popular for sunbathing, cliff cafes, and ayurveda.
nearest_railway: Varkala Sivagiri Railway Station — approx. 2 km (very near town).
nearest_bus: Varkala bus stands (local/regional) — in town.
nearest_airport: Thiruvananthapuram International Airport — approx. 39 km
accessibility: Cliff requires steps; some parts not wheelchair-friendly though town has roads for surface access.
guided_tours: Local guides for temple/heritage and ayurvedic centres; English commonly supported by resorts.
parking: Town parking available; charges vary.
nearby_amenities: Cafés on cliff, resorts, ayurvedic centers, shops.
official_website: Varkala tourism pages and Kerala Tourism mentions
special_notes: Unique geological cliffs facing Arabian Sea; Janardana Swami Temple and Sivagiri Mutt nearby; popular for yoga and wellness tourism.
